intro: ^! Glad to see you. The next book in that N.K Jemisen series is ready for you. We just got new copies in."

s: ^Hey Rashad! That's great, I was waiting on it.
^Really? I've been stoked for it, thanks for letting me know it's in.

Chat1: ^Rashad?Smiling "I got us a grant to add more Black and Latinx authors to our shelves, so if you have recommendations, I'm here for them."

s: ^I do have some recommendations. Congrats on the grant, that's really exciting.
^I can totally make some suggestions; I'll put a list together. I have a quick question for you, though.

Chat2: ^Rashad?Smiling "It is, isn't it? I've been trying to make sure we focus on what the community will use."
^Rashad?Smiling "Last board meeting, one of the members recommended white noise machines. Can you imagine? The myth of a stuffy, quiet Library is so last century!"

s: ^No one needs those in here. Before I forget, though, I could use your help.
^Ugh. Catch up, people! Oh hey, I have a question for you.
^I'm helping Mr. Calindas with some research, and I was hoping for your input.

Explain2: ^Rashad?Neutral "Oh? My input? What do you need to know?"

s: ^What community health issues or programs do older Library patrons ask about?
^What does the community need to know about their own health?

Suggestion1: ^Rashad_Day 1_Free health and mental well-being classes are useful to underserved communities_Mrcalindas1-3

Suggestion1.#: notification Rashad_Day 1_Free health and mental well-being classes are useful to underserved communities_Mrcalindas1-3

Suggestion1: ^Rashad?Smiling "We get a lot of requests for materials in various languages. This is important for English-as-a-second-language, or ESL, speakers to access our programming."
^Rashad?Smiling "Also, access to free health classes or mental health classes is really useful. The Library hosts a few workshops - some general basics - you know, things that apply to everyone."

^Rashad?Smiling "When Cheryl's mom, my mother-in-law, was diagnosed with lupus, an auto-immune disorder, she attended classes just for people with her diagnosis, and it really helped her feel more hopeful."

s: ^Oh, those are really good points. What else?
^OK, I'm following. Do you have other suggestions?

Suggestion2: ^Rashad_Day 1_Building trust is vital in providing healthcare support to communities_Mrcalindas1-4

Suggestion2.#: notification Rashad_Day 1_Building trust is vital in providing healthcare support to communities_Mrcalindas1-4

Suggestion2: ^Rashad?Neutral "I feel like there aren't a lot of places people can go to ask questions if they're scared; forming ongoing relationships make it possible to provide that sort of support."
^Rashad?Neutral "Combating vaccine hesitancy starts with building trust within the community."

s: ^I think Mr. Calindas will find this super helpful. Thanks, Rashad!
^That's really insightful, Rashad. I'll take this back to the clinic.

Goodbye: ^Rashad?Smiling "Oh, well that's good. Thanks for asking my thoughts. Okay, I'm going to go to my next meeting I'll catch you around

s: ^I'll send you those book recommendations, okay? Take care!
